title: Birth of James Smith
description: James Smith, the patriarch of our family tree, was born in rural Pennsylvania. He would go on to serve in World War II and establish the Smith Family Farm.

title: James and Margaret's Wedding
description: James Smith married Margaret Wilson in a small ceremony during World War II. Their love story spanned over 60 years and produced a large, loving family.

title: Purchase of the Smith Family Farm
description: After returning from WWII, James purchased 50 acres of land that would become the Smith Family Farm, a gathering place for generations to come.

title: The Second Generation
description: James and Margaret welcomed their children: Robert (1945) and Mary (1947). The family thrived on the farm, raising livestock and crops.

title: First Family Reunion
description: The first official Smith Family Reunion was held at the farm, establishing a tradition that continues to this day. Over 30 family members attended.

title: The Third Generation Arrives
description: The 1980s and 90s saw the arrival of the third generation, including John, Sarah, and Michael. The family continued to grow and flourish.

title: New Millennium Celebration
description: The family gathered for a special millennium celebration at the farm. James and Margaret, both in their 80s, were surrounded by over 50 descendants.

title: The Fourth Generation
description: The fourth generation began arriving, with Emily (2010) and James Jr. (2013) among the first. The family tree continues to grow and branch out.

title: Loss of Patriarch James
description: James Smith passed away peacefully at age 95, surrounded by family. His legacy lives on through his descendants and the farm he built.

title: Loss of Matriarch Margaret
description: Margaret Smith joined her beloved husband, passing away at age 98. She was remembered for her kindness, wisdom, and the love she showed to all.

title: Launch of Digital Family Tree
description: The family launched this digital platform to preserve our history and keep our growing family connected across the miles.
